pageTitle: Prime Ministerâ€™s itinerary for Friday, February 5, 2021 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

Ottawa, Ontario

Private meetings.

11:30 a.m. The Prime Minister will address Canadians on the COVID-19 situation. A media availability will follow.

Rideau Cottage
1 Sussex Drive

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media are asked to arrive to the Princess Anne Entrance no later than 11:00 a.m. and to make their way to the P1 Gate once on the grounds.
  • Media wishing to cover the event must be accredited with the Parliamentary Press Gallery.
  • Journalists can dial in to listen and ask questions to the Prime Minister.
  • Participant dial-in numbers:
    Local: 613-954-9003
    Toll-free: 1-866-206-0153
    Pass code: 6822783#

3:10 p.m. The Prime Minister, joined by Minister of Northern Affairs Dan Vandal, will virtually visit the Youth BIOLab at the St. Boniface Hospital Albrechtsen Research Centre in Winnipeg, Manitoba.

3:55 p.m. The Prime Minister, joined by Minister of Environment and Climate Change Jonathan Wilkinson, will virtually visit grade 11 students in the Global Perspectives Program at Sutherland Secondary school in North Vancouver, British Columbia.

5:10 p.m. The Prime Minister, joined by Parliamentary Secretary to the Minister of National Revenue Francesco Sorbara, will virtually visit Artistic Skylight, a local business in Woodbridge, Ontario.

Closed to media.
